file_content.text: You! What have you done?
Whole cities are being torched by the Eagle's weapons. The Dark Council is in a rage. You were supposed to stop the attack!
Darth Jadus changed my mind.
Things are different now.
That's impossible. My father was a part of this...?
Listen to me, Zhorrid--your father is alive.
I have news about Jadus.
My father...? Dad...?
You're lying. Darth Jadus is dead--he died because of the Eagle, and the Dark Council and everyone!
Jadus ordered me to kill you.
He sent me here.
He wouldn't do that to me. He would kill me himself! You lie.
Leave here, or he'll destroy you.
Please, flee the Citadel.
No. You're lying--you're working for the rest of the Dark Council!
After all the times I spared you.... But there'll be no mercy now.
Let me put you out of your misery.
Foolish Sith. [Attack]
Time to die. [Attack]
You think you can defeat me? I still have enough power to stop you...!
Get away. Get away from me....
Physical trauma includes electrical burns, lacerations and retinal damage. Transfer to a kolto tank for long-term recovery is strongly recommended.
You'd suggest a Dark Council member hide in a vat? For "healing"?
I am programmed to dispense medical advice based on all--
Get out! Have yourself disassembled, made into a probe and sent to the most desolate place in the Empire!
Look, agent. They hurt me and then they laughed. How could they...?
Who did, my lord?
"They"?
Your injuries, my lord--is there anything I can do?
Let me assist.
No. There isn't.
Maybe someone felt you needed humbling.
I can think of reasons.
I'm a Dark Lord of the Sith. I'm not meant to be humble. I'm meant to humble the world.
After Vyord Yanol broke, I called the council to assembly. I demanded the lords give me the respect I was due.
I thought I was ready. I called the council to assembly. I demanded the lords give me the respect I was due.
Some were angry. Mocked me. They... tormented me and warned me not to overstep my bounds again.
The Dark Council did this.
It was the Sith?
They called me an arrogant child, unworthy of my position.
That sounds... terrible, my lord.
I'm so sorry.
You'll get revenge on them, surely?
Make them hurt.
Oh, agent, you don't understand!
It's all Jadus's fault! He was my master, but he never taught me what I needed to know. Now he's dead--and I'm not ready for his council seat!
I don't know what to tell you. I'm so sorry.
That's very unfortunate.
For letting my father get assassinated? Or for failing me?
You're his daughter. He must have taught you something.
You're too hard on yourself.
Do you know what kind of creature Darth Jadus was? When I was young, he taught me how to sing.
He said song was a blade to cut emotion from others. He had musicians tutor me for a year.
My lord, this is none of my business.
Isn't this a little personal?
What happened after a year?
Oh?
I don't need to know about your upbringing.
I don't want to hear this.
When I was ready, my father arranged a performance for me in Kaas City. I sang for hours. I made the audience weep.
I sang until my throat was raw and damaged. I sang until I could never sing again.
Thus purged of the capacity for song, I saw my father smile. That's how he began my apprenticeship.
I don't know what to say.
That's... something.
It taught me a great deal. And it taught me to hate Darth Jadus.
You became strong. You became powerful.
You did learn, though.
Yes. Just not powerful enough.
That's no excuse for what you are now.
I have no sympathy.
Be silent! Or you'll be punished.
If you're not fit for the responsibility, you should abdicate.
Then leave the council.
Fool! All my enemies would strike at me then. And all Jadus's, too.
I know what's happening in Imperial Intelligence. I know you're going on a mission, and that the Eagle wasn't the man you thought.
Swear that you'll find whoever really killed my father. Swear that the man responsible will pay for forcing me into this wretched life.
I swear I will make him pay.
Very well.
Jadus's killers never hurt you.
It's not the murderer's fault.
My priority is deactivating the Eradicators, not revenge.
That's not my mission.
You would deny me this? I am still Sith!
If Darth Jadus hadn't been murdered, I would never have taken his place on the council! I would never have been humiliated.
His killers are to blame. Swear you'll make them hurt.
All right. I swear.
I obey.
Yes. You'll exact my revenge... and the world will be made right.
I have gifts for you, agent. Take them with my blessing and leave me to salt my wounds... and to gain strength from my hatred.
I won't do it, Zhorrid. If I can bring them to justice, I will--but that's all.
I'm not an assassin.
You're pathetic, Zhorrid.
This is just sad.
Get out. Get out of my sight, now!
Crawl out of here. Before I decide you're worth burning.
You're trying my patience.
Do you think you've learned your lesson yet, Keeper?
Ah--ahhhh! Yes... my lord.
I don't like that name. You certainly haven't done a very good job of keeping your agents.
Speaking of which--Cipher Nine! Your superior and I were just chatting.
I can see that. I hope I'm not interrupting.
Yes, my lord.
Not at all. You should watch closely.
What's this about? What did he do to deserve this?
What's going on?
It's not what he did. It's what you did.
Are you alright, sir?
Keeper? What's wrong?
I'm fine, agent. I'll...
Speak to me, not to him! He wouldn't be here if not for your lack of respect.
You see, in our last conversation, you said... something that irked me. I don't remember what.
I thought about having you killed. But then I thought, "Who's really responsible here"? And I decided to punish Keeper.
Your reasoning is impeccable, as always.
A wise decision.
What do you plan to do to him?
Punish him how?
I don't know. I'm starting to get bored.
Keeper didn't do anything wrong.
He's innocent.
You're truly ignorant of the nature of authority.
Keeper? You can go. The Cipher and I have business.
I appreciate that, my lord.
As for you, Cipher--good to see you alive. It's getting dangerous.
Dangerous--and unpredictable.
I follow your meaning.
Exactly. Be careful.
I'm so sorry about this, sir.
This is my fault.
I'll be fine. I have kolto sprays in my office. Be careful.
Say "hi" to the Watchers when you stumble into headquarters.
Pathetic old man.
I'll pass on the message.
Come in, dear Cipher. I was just listening to Lord Ulios's latest opera.
Music brightens my day--and we of the council have few bright days. You can't imagine the burden.
I'm sure I can't.
No, my lord.
My lord? Why are there corpses on the floor?
About those bodies...
These? Oh. I think they were part of the aria.
I'm not here to chat about music.
Let's talk business.
Really? Pity.
So! Vyord Yanol--is that him? Or is this another body for my collection?
I retrieved Yanol, as you commanded.
It's him.
Oh, agent.
You have a... body collection?
Collection?
I'm joking, agent.
I can drop him with the others, if you like.
Can't it be both?
Oh, no. Yanol is delicate. He must be treated with care.
Why hire a bounty hunter when you've got me?
I did your dirty work.
You don't ever have to worry about that.
Yanol and I are going to spend some time together. He's going to reveal every secret my father ever had.
Expect a token of my appreciation. And expect to be called on again, my Cipher.
It'll give me something to look forward to.
Thank you, my lord.
Think of it. Dream of me, and of your service to me.
Anyone from Imperial Intelligence would serve the same.
I'm nothing special.
If you want these terrorists handled, you'll allow me to work.
Just let me do my job.
No reward, then! You will continue without my favor.
Now leave me to my new advisor--Yanol and I need our privacy.
So! Vyord Yanol. Did you find my dear father's advisor? Was everything as I said?
I found the hideout, but Yanol had already fled.
He was gone.
Your information was good, but there was an accident.
Yanol's dead.
People who get lost on Nar Shaddaa don't get found.
No idea.
You mean to say you failed me?
I give you the chance of a lifetime--the chance to serve a member of the Dark Council--and you fail? Completely and utterly?
How dare you, Cipher! Yanol knew my father's secrets! He was to lift me above my rivals!
All I can do is beg forgiveness.
I'm sorry, my lord.
There is no one whose power rivals yours, my lord.
You don't need his help.
Oh? You're right, you know.
I did everything I could. If that's not good enough for you....
It wasn't my fault!
Ah... you sorry, pathetic creature.
Perhaps it was an impossible task; if I couldn't secure my father's secrets, it's no surprise you couldn't, either.
I shall stand alone against the Dark Council--force them to respect me, listen to me. Even without Jadus's "wisdom."
I'm certain you have what it takes to impress them.
I agree.
I do not need your certainty.
I'm certain your father would be proud.
That'd impress Jadus.
My father met pride with scorn. All things--even his own works--were worth loathing.
Are you sure you're not being hasty?
It sounds dangerous.
No. It's past time I asserted myself.
You disappointed me today, Cipher--but you also taught me something. Because of that, I forgive you.
Do not fail ever again.
Silence! You've been dismissed.
Oh, wonderful. My poor bodyguards...
I'm starting to get a little peeved. And a little creeped out.
We haven't been introduced. I'm Darth Zhorrid, Lord of the Dark Council and successor to Darth Jadus.
I hear you're investigating my father's assassination. I wanted to see if you were worthy.
The attack was a test, then.
I think I understand.
I didn't want to hurt those men.
Your guards were innocent!
But you did, and it pleased me. We'll send the commander's children a bottle of liqueur with our condolences.
You tried to kill me.
You've got a lot of gall.
I didn't try to kill you--I had my servants try to kill you.
I could sense your feelings during the fight. I think you'll do nicely, tracking these terrorists.
But are you really sure that this "Eagle" killed the mighty Darth Jadus?
You saw his announcement--he took responsibility.
It seems likely.
It was quite a speech. But it doesn't prove anything.
Why do you ask?
A curious question.
Because I thought you might know more than your superiors.
If you have another theory, why don't you tell me?
Say what you mean.
I should make you crawl and beg for my wisdom. Later, perhaps.
Jadus... Jadus believed in spreading fear and anger to every planet and species in the Empire. Even to creatures like you.
Jadus believed in spreading fear and anger to every corner of the Empire. He wished to share the ideals of the Sith.
Perhaps his ambitions drew too much attention; any one of his rivals on the Dark Council might have killed him.
You think a Sith was behind the attack.
His rivals...
Perhaps. Perhaps not.
You're his daughter... how did you feel about him?
What about you?
Oh, I hated my father. He taught me to keep my emotions seething inside, and show no one. I disobeyed.
If you're right, you're the next obvious target.
You may be in danger.
You're so kind to be concerned.
Chase after your terrorists. Save the lives of your Imperial friends. But if you learn who's really responsible, come to me.
I've earned my place on the Dark Council--and I won't share my father's fate. Dismissed!
Hush. The delightful bodyguards are trying to kill you.
Look who made it all the way to Korriban--I think we have a visitor!
Yes, my lord.
Commander--I want to be informal with my bodyguards.
Ah--yes, Lady Zhorrid.
Delightful. You, my pretty alien--don't you find my bodyguards delightful?
Delightful. You, visitor--don't you find my bodyguards delightful?
Absolutely delightful, my lord.
Certainly.
Excellent!
I'm from Imperial Intelligence, my lord.
You sent for me?
I'm aware of that. And you have the honor of speaking to a member of the Dark Council.
This experience should be the highlight of your life--but instead of answering my question, you tell me what I already know.
I'm afraid I don't share your views.
Not really.
Oh. How difficult it must be, to live your life with so little taste.
Delightful bodyguard? I have a request.
Yes, my lady?
Kill our visitor, please.
As you wish. She's as good as dead.
As you wish. He's as good as dead.
You're trying my patience.
You're not on the Dark Council. You should be bowing to me.
But you did, and it pleased me. We'll send the lieutenant's children a bottle of liqueur with our condolences.
Lieutenant--I want to be informal with my bodyguards.
Look who's here--I think we have a visitor!
Cipher Nine. It's past time you contacted me.
Why did he flee? And why here?
Why?
Why would Jadus keep secrets from you?
Secrets?
I came to Nar Shaddaa as fast as I could, my lord.
I'm doing my duty.
Oh? Well, we'll have to have your ship scrapped--we can get you a faster one!
What are you doing? I gave you the command to find Vyord Yanol!
